page.title: 02PORT OF GLOUCESTER
page.content: BRITISH WATERWAYS ARE MAKING MAJOR ALTERATIONS TO THE PORT. THE CANAL WHARVES AND MONKMEADOW DOCK,SOUTH OF THE OLD PORT NOW HANDLE CARGO AND ROAD TRANSPORT MOVE GOODS INSTEAD OF TRAINS AND RAILWAYS ARE DISUSED. TWO DRYDOCKS REMAIN AT GLOUCESTER DOCK NOW A MOORING FOR B.W. TUGS,DREDGERS AND MAINTENANCE VESSELS PLUS SOME SHIPS PASSING ALONG THE SEVERN WATERWAY. THE CANAL IS TO BE ENLARGED TO ALLOW LARGER SHIPS TO TRAVEL THE SEVERN ROUTE. SOME WAREHOUSES WILL BE CONVERTED AS COUNCIL OFFICES, A MUSEUM,RESTAURANTS AN ANTIQUE CENTRE AND B.W. STORES. DERELICT WAREHOUSES AND SHEDS WILL BE DEMOLISHED TO BUILD NEW COMMERCIAL PREMISES. THE VICTORIA BASIS WILL BE A MARINA AND BARGE ARM PRESERVED AS A DOCKLAND FILM SET FOR SAILING SHIPS.
